image.altText: A man in sunnies stands by the ocean

props.synopsis: A man has died two weeks after becoming unresponsive during an arrest in Adelaide's eastern suburbs, his partner has told the ABC.

title.children: SA man dies two weeks after becoming unresponsive during arrest

image.altText: A middle-aged man and a young man stand back to back, arms on their hip, both wearing caps. Blue sky with clouds in the backgro

props.synopsis: After surviving a horrific crash while cycling together six years ago, Travis and his son Brayden McKenzie made a promise to compete in an Ironman competition. This weekend that plan is coming to fruition.

title.children: Father and son crash survivors to fulfil Ironman pact

image.altText: A young woman wearing a hat and pink shirt standing next to her ute with two border collies

props.synopsis: Annie Doecke is part of a growing number of young Australian women taking up sheepdog trialling as the demographics of the sport shift.

title.children: Young women and canine sidekicks take the lead in once male-dominated sport

image.altText: Farmer Greg Finlay is removing a fence from flood debris.

props.synopsis: Many people are wondering how they can help struggling farmers hit hard this past year by drought and floods. It turns out there are options.

title.children: Fixing fences and buying local — you can help farmers doing it tough

image.altText: A small white lamb wearing a grey woolen jumper next to hay

props.synopsis: A woman who rescued a lamb that was left locked in a skate park without milk for two days says the council should investigate the incident.

title.children: Starving newborn lamb recovering after being locked in skate park

image.altText: Machinery and cranes around a large shed with letters ASC on the iron door next to a river

props.synopsis: Traders near the shipyard where AUKUS submarines are planned to be built have mixed reactions to the US government's AUKUS review, as Premier Peter Malinauskas seeks to downplay concerns over the announcement.

title.children: 'Pretty nervous': Adelaide shipyard traders react to AUKUS review

image.altText: Two high-rise office building in a green open space

props.synopsis: A 38-storey office building with shops, restaurants and a public plaza is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, after the proposal was given planning approval despite concerns about heritage.

title.children: Skyscraper behind SA parliament gets green light despite heritage fears

image.altText: A red dirt road along bushland and mountains in the distance

props.synopsis: South Australian police say missing man Kyle has been found safe and well after an extensive search in the northern Flinders Ranges.

title.children: Man missing for nearly two weeks in Flinders Ranges found safe

image.altText: GettyImages-2219782218

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister claims the 800m women's freestyle record in Adelaide, before hugging swimming champion Dawn Fraser poolside.

title.children: Pallister breaks 800m record and embraces Aussie legend in emotional scenes

image.altText: Taylor Walker holds a ball while walking with Matthew Nicks

props.synopsis: Adelaide coach Matthew Nicks says a "lack of accountability" remains a problem in reporting around players' futures as a story involving Taylor Walker and Nasiah Wanageen-Milera dominates headlines.

title.children: 'Unfair to all': Nicks calls out reporter's Walker racism claim

image.altText: A man holding papers and a notebook walks outside a court building with a woman behind him

props.synopsis: Independent MP Nick McBride says he will not walk away from state parliament, while facing court charged with three counts of assaulting his wife.

title.children: MP accused of assaulting wife to run for seat at next SA election

image.altText: A metal wall with Broken Hill Police Station written on it

props.synopsis: Police say they are speaking with a child as part of their investigations into the stabbing death of a 36-year-old man in outback New South Wales.

title.children: Boy, 12, assisting police following fatal stabbing in Broken Hill

image.altText: A sign saying CORONERS COURT on a modern sandstone building

props.synopsis: A great-grandmother who died after gall bladder surgery at a regional South Australian hospital could still be alive if a surgeon had abandoned the procedure earlier or had access to a CT scan, a coroner finds.

title.children: Inquest finds death of 76yo great-grandmother could have been prevented after surgery

image.altText: Temba Bavuma, Pat Cummins and Marnus Labuschagne.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins reaches a magic marker, Temba Bavuma finally gets one right, and batting remains brutal on day two at Lord's. Here are the quick hits from the World Test Championship final.

title.children: Five quick hits: Collapses, classic catches and Cummins's continued climb

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone in front of American flags and gold curtains.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says an Israeli attack on Iran "looks like something that could very well happen" as American personnel are moved out of the region and Iran announces plans for a new nuclear enrichment facility.

title.children: Trump warns of 'chance of massive conflict' as Iran-Israel tensions rise

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

props.synopsis: For more than a week, accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson protested her innocence from the witness box in her Supreme Court murder trial.

title.children: 'That's not true': Erin Patterson says deadly lunch was not a murder plot

image.altText: A singer and fellow performers on stage at the Cabaret Fringe Festival

props.synopsis: The final curtain has come down on two Adelaide festivals, who say more needs to be done to support the second level of South Australia's entertainment calendar.

title.children: Money woes force Adelaide festivals to shut

image.altText: Hands of nurse places band-aid on a woman's arm in a vaccination clinic.

props.synopsis: The number of Australians vaccinated against influenza is "worryingly low", health experts say, as new data reveal the winter flu season has begun.

title.children: 'Now is the time': Parents urged to vaccinate kids against flu

image.altText: A hole in a brick apartment block.

props.synopsis: The explosion occurred in a second-level unit in Lidcombe on Friday morning, where residents "self-evacuated" before emergency services arrived.

title.children: Residents not allowed inside homes after explosion rocks apartment block

image.altText: Four people sit close together as they pose for a picture.

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer tells jurors they cannot right the wrongs of Victoria's youth, during the trial of a man accused of murdering a Box Hill doctor.

title.children: Court hears boys left fatally wounded GP lying lifeless on ground

image.altText: albanese close up

props.synopsis: Let's never knock a summit, but let's not be taken in by the suggestion that the planned August meeting, involving employers, unions and the government, will mark some breakthrough moment.

title.children: The galahs are chattering about productivity. But can Labor really get it moving?

image.altText: The hands of a person counting through piles of $100 US dollar notes

props.synopsis: The US dollar is on the slide, while investors are shying away from the world's reserve currency and traders grow increasingly uncertain about Donald Trump's economic policy.

title.children: US dollar hits multi-year low amid warnings of 'dangerous' Trump policies

image.altText: A model of 3D printed oil barrels is seen in front of displayed stock graph going down in this illustration taken.

props.synopsis: Markets are also digesting inflation data and the US-China trade talks. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Oil and gold prices jump, while shares slip after Israel strikes Iran

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gold climbs after Israel attacks Iran's nuclear program
Oil prices jump 7.6pc after Israel air strikes on Iran
How soon could Israel's attack on Iran send oil prices above $US100?

image.altText: A man bends down to pose for a photo with Syrian children holding the Singapore flag

props.synopsis: Since its birth as a nation, Singapore has been a close partner of Israel. But the "special relationship" has been strained by the war in Gaza and its toll on Palestinian civilians.

title.children: Singapore and Israel's 'deep, dark, secret love affair' imperilled by Gaza

image.altText: Malcolm Turnbull looks to the right of frame in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: Malcolm Turnbull has chipped Scott Morrison over the AUKUS deal, saying the former PM's "great achievement" may be leaving Australia with no new submarines.

title.children: Turnbull wants Australia to invest in alternative defence capabilities as US reviews AUKUS

image.altText: a film crew are on a beach on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Netflix drama The Survivors is set in the made-up town of Evelyn Bay, created using various Tasmanian locations. The crew took over pubs, cafes and dangerous sea cliffs during the show's filming.

title.children: 'Complete township' created in Tassie for new Netflix series

image.altText: Gloved hands hold a tube over a canister which has mist coming out of it.

props.synopsis: Rachel Smith, who will be eligible for parole in 2029, appealed after the Supreme Court ruled a decision by corrective services to withhold the service was lawful.

title.children: Prisoner takes fight to freeze her eggs to Queensland's highest court

image.altText: Joan places a peg on her nose and takes a selfie in Slanted.

props.synopsis: Slanted sees debut Australian director Amy Wang's morbid teenage dream come true, as an aspiring prom queen signs up for radical surgery to change her race.

title.children: The Australian behind the Crazy Rich Asians sequel on her debut feature

image.altText: The SES and Victoria Police are rescuing about 20 people stuck on Mount Hotham.

props.synopsis: From the Socceroos qualifying for the FIFA World Cup to popular sunscreens not passing SPF testing, it was another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An epic Roland-Garros final, stranded travellers and a quirky unofficial town mascot

image.altText: Tasmanian Labor party's campaign launch in Hobart 2025-06-12 10:06:00

props.synopsis: Following a week of political mudslinging, Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff and Labor leader Dean Winter say they will attempt to project a "positive" image for the state in the freshly started election campaign.

title.children: Stadium, ships and stability — parties make first pitch in Tasmanian election nobody wanted

image.altText: Max Verstappen wiping his face with a towel after a qualifying session, facing another driver

props.synopsis: Formula 1 is back in North America for round 10 of the championship, with Oscar Piastri leading the standings and the defending world champion facing a suspension. Here is everything you need to know about the 2025 Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix.

title.children: F1 ban hovers over Max as he loses grip of his world championship crown

image.altText: GettyImages-1775360018

props.synopsis: Tom Harley's AFL career almost only lasted for one game. Now, the former Port and Geelong player has become one of the most important people in footy.

title.children: How an almost one-game wonder traded up to hold the keys to AFL House

image.altText: GettyImages-74010665

props.synopsis: Equestrian Australia suspends Beijing Olympics competitor Heath Ryan over a video of him whipping a horse.

title.children: Equestrian Australia suspends Olympian who was filmed whipping a horse
